Issues.Title: Winforms apps crash when using clipboard APIs
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview6-012099

Windows version: Win10

Does the bug reproduce also in Winforms for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

Problem description:
Using some of the Clipboard APIs, throw exceptions and cause application crashes.
E.g.
Clipboard.SetData(DataFormats.UnicodeText, "abc");

Actual behavior: 
Throws an ExecutionEngineException.

Expected behavior:
sets the data to the clipboard without issue

Minimal repro:
Clipboard.SetData(DataFormats.UnicodeText, "abc");

this issue was found in WPF as well, we've filed a coreclr issue as we believe that's where the root cause is.

https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/issues/24816
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/775
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms apps crash when using clipboard APIs" (#1060)

Issues.Title: Fix ApiCompatBaseline.netcoreapp.txt
Issues.Body: Minimise the number of APIs missing. Some sort of tooling allowing false-negatives (i.e. APIs that actually do exist but are written in as not existing) to be notified would help!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix ApiCompatBaseline.netcoreapp.txt " (#1059)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Fixing ItemStatus property in programmatically sorted DataGridView
Issues.Body: Fixes #1054.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Accessibility: Fixing ItemStatus property in programmatically sorted DataGridView" (#1055)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Programmatically sorted DataGridView does not expose the current sort order and column in ItemStatus property
Issues.Body:
Ported bug 792776.
Steps to reproduce in simple WinForms test app:

1. Create a WinForms app with the DataGridView control with column that is configured to use programmatic sort.​
2. Sort the DataGridView by the column with programmatic sort method.​
3. Use the Inspect SDK tool to find the current sort order through UIA.​


**Result:** Sort column and order isn't exposed in ItemStatus property of the DataGridView accessible object in Inspect.​
**Expected:** ItemStatus property should provide the column by which the DataGridView is sorted and sort order, eg. "Sorted (Ascending)"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: Programmatically sorted DataGridView does not expose the current sort order and column in ItemStatus property" (#1054)

Issues.Title: [Net Core][LOC]The ‘Misc’ component is not translated in local languages OS
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview6-012067
* VS: Dev16 16.2 Preview 1 d16.2 28921.214
* OS: CHS RS3 X64
* Affected OS: CHS, CHT, CSY, DEU, ESN, FRA, ITA, JPN, KOR, PTB, RUS, TRK, PLK 13 languages

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
The ‘Misc’ component text is not translated in local languages OS.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
The ‘Msic’ component is not localized in local languages OS.
e.g. CHS
![Screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18568603/58310448-36d9f480-7e39-11e9-97e2-4485aee84774.png)

**Expected behavior:**
The ‘Msic’ should be translated according to the corresponding languages.

**Minimal repro:**
1.	Install latest VS & .NET Core 3.0 on CHS machine, then open the attached app.
[FrameworkApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3215616/FrameworkApp.zip)
[CoreApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3215617/CoreApp.zip)
2.	Run it and observe the Misc component headers of PropertyGrid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Net Core][LOC]The ‘Misc’ component is not translated in local languages OS" (#1036)
